posts.post_content: The key is to have bigger & better creatures or artifacts than your opponents, eg. Deep-Sea Kraken, Kederekt Leviathan, Darksteel Colossus or whatever. Of course, if Braids dies before I put out my critters it's basically game over. Using a Vedalkin Orrery to play it with flash didn't really work for me - if anything it'd be better to play Braids earlier (with High Tide, say) when they wouldn't expect it.
posts.html:
The key is to have bigger & better creatures or artifacts than your opponents, eg. Deep-Sea Kraken, Kederekt Leviathan, Darksteel Colossus or whatever. Of course, if Braids dies before I put out my critters it's basically game over. Using a Vedalkin Orrery to play it with flash didn't really work for me - if anything it'd be better to play Braids earlier (with High Tide, say) when they wouldn't expect it.

Posted By: Cyberium (5/22/2010 3:56:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Young Braids suffers like all the other cards which "share the love" with your opponents ([Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine), [Eladamri's Vineyard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eladamri's Vineyard), [Kami of the Crescent Moon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kami of the Crescent Moon) etc.) from the fact that you are the last player who gets rewarded. And being a creature increases the risk that she is gone and you get nothing when your next turn begins. That said, she guarantees great moments in multiplayer if she somehow sticks around.
  
You could try to play her at instant speed with [Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir), [Winding Canyons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Winding Canyons) or [Vedalken Orrery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Orrery).
posts.html:
Young Braids suffers like all the other cards which "share the love" with your opponents (Howling Mine, Eladamri's Vineyard, Kami of the Crescent Moon etc.) from the fact that you are the last player who gets rewarded. And being a creature increases the risk that she is gone and you get nothing when your next turn begins. That said, she guarantees great moments in multiplayer if she somehow sticks around.
You could try to play her at instant speed with Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir, Winding Canyons or Vedalken Orrery.

Posted By: holgir (9/3/2009 8:35:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Iceeharmony - [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) only affect permanents on the battlefield. Instants and sorceries are never permanents. And enchantments or planeswalkers wouldn't count as permanents while they're in your hand. So if you're actually asking a serious question and not just being tongue-in-cheek, the answer is no.
posts.html:
@Iceeharmony - Mycosynth Lattice only affect permanents on the battlefield. Instants and sorceries are never permanents. And enchantments or planeswalkers wouldn't count as permanents while they're in your hand. So if you're actually asking a serious question and not just being tongue-in-cheek, the answer is no.
